title: Mississippi National River & Recreation Area: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Mississippi National River & Recreation Area is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Bike the Mississippi River Trail  The Mississippi River Trail, a bicycle trail designated from the headwaters of the Mississippi River in Minnesota to the Gulf of Mexico, provides some unique views of the Mississippi River. The more than 3,000 miles of designated trail vary from pedestrian and bicycle only paths to on-road bikeways. One great ways to explore Mississippi National River and Recreation Area is by bicycle. Read more   Ranger On Call  Ranger On Call is an audio tour to the Mississippi National River and Recreation Area. Explore one of six tours virtually, on foot or by bicycle including the Coldwater Spring Tour. For centuries, Coldwater Spring has played an important role in the  lives of people living along the Mississippi River. Today, it’s a national park boasting restored oak savanna and prairie. Take a walk and learn about  its important place in Minnesota history. Read more      Call to Action Projects    Learn more about the work we're doing to prepare for the future.
